blurb: New video footage shows how the Humboldt squid could use skin patterns to camouflage and communicate
description: We may never truly know what animals are thinking and saying, but scientists are working to crack the animal communication code. This gets tricky for animals that don’t emit any sound and don’t live in a place that’s easy to see. The Humboldt squid, which lives in the open ocean, falls into both categories, but that didn’t deter researchers at Stanford and National Geographic. In a 2015 study, the team revealed some of the latest gossip among Humboldt squids in their natural oceanic habitat.
title: If Squids Could Talk
